titleInfo.title: In Conformity to the Provisions of an Act.

mods.abstract: IN CONFORMITY to the provisions of an Act entitled an Act in relation to Slaves detained in the Police Jails in the Municipalities of New Orleans -- approved March 10, 1816 -- notice is hereby given that the following persons are confined in the Police Jail of the First District (late Second Municipality : JUDA, a griffe, aged about 50 years, 5 feet 3 1/2 inches high. Says she belongs to Mr. Girod. JOE, a mulatto, aged about 49 years, 5 feet 8 inches high. Says he is free, but reported as belonging to Messrs. Small & McGill. JOSEPH or Albert, a dark griffe, aged about 53 years. 5 feet 3 1/2 inches high ; has a scar on his lip. Says he belongs to Mr. Williams or Fletcher, of Texas. The owners thereof are hereby notified and requested to prove property, pay charges thereon, and take them away within a delay of three months, otherwise they will be sold in conformity to the above law. JONATHAN WORRALL, Warden. New Orleans, November 28, 1853. n29
mods.note: Mr. Girod; Messrs. Small & McGill; Mr. Williams or Fletcher
Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
